summary: "The Alchymist, in Search of the Philosopher's Stone" by Joseph Wright depicts a common goal in alchemy: finding the mythical philosopher's stone. This substance was believed to turn common metals into gold and silver, and create an elixir of life, granting immortality. Alchemists spent centuries searching for it, calling this quest the "Great Work." The stone symbolized perfection and divine power, making it alchemy's most desired treasure.
title: Philosopher's stone
